Text: Only Congress has the power to declare war, and it is our constitutional duty to vote on any effort to use military force. @POTUS made the right call by not committing troops to Ukraine. I joined colleagues to affirm Congress' role if troops are requested. https://t.co/POLJmQOfY2

This week our nation's wealthiest will stop paying into #SocialSecurity for the rest of the year. Let's pass Social Security 2100: A Sacred Trust so this is the last year they go without paying their fair share! https://t.co/J7OQtYxcMX

Connecticut's First District is home to a vibrant Ukrainian-American community, and I was proud to stand in solidarity with neighbors in Hartford speaking out against Russian aggression. Our shared democratic values are ironclad. https://t.co/20g42gI3GO

The poverty rate for Black children has been cut nearly in half since the 1980s, yet they are still more likely to live in poverty than white children.
 
We must extend the #ChildTaxCredit and pass #Secure2100 to improve America’s most crucial anti-poverty programs. https://t.co/Wfm4UAOsea

The Redding encampment housed 3,000 soldiers in the winter of 1778-1779. A new grant to Windsor's CRIS Radio will allow them to create an audio tour that gives voice to the African Americans, women, and indigenous people at Redding during the Revolution. https://t.co/LpkcQmCPwW

Our nation's most vulnerable need Social Security. I introduced Social Security 2100: A Sacred Trust Act because I want to make sure this program serves our country well for years to come. Time to pass this bill! #Secure2100 #SocialSecurityValentines https://t.co/YQoct9ikDL

Even if you don't normally file a tax return, the IRS is urging everyone to file this year. You may be eligible for the #ChildTaxCredit or the Earned Income Tax Credit. At https://t.co/7obb6GEi0p, most taxpayers can file a return and find out which credits or deductions to claim.

Congratulations to West Hartford kindergarten teacher Lori Durocher for being awarded the Presidential Award for Excellence in Science Teaching. Her efforts to apply science and engineering across the curriculum are recognized as a model for other schools. We are so proud of you!

When young people want to serve their country, we should give them the opportunity to do so. ACTION would meet the needs of our communities while ensuring the next generation can access affordable education.

We need to make college more affordable & address the climate crisis- this bill is our opportunity to do both. ACTION would support AT LEAST 1 million federal service positions a year and establish a Civilian Climate Corp.

Proud to reintroduce ACTION for National Service Act alongside @SenatorJackReed. This bill would increase service opportunities through programs like @AmeriCorps while making college more affordable. #Action4Service https://t.co/tt8Ljxu5I7

There's been an alarming trend of state-sanctioned abuses against the LGBTQI+ community around the world. We passed the #GlobalRespectAct to protect victims of violence and persecution, and make clear that the U.S. will not stay silent and allow these abuses at home or abroad. https://t.co/I98Lr8koen

I’m proud of my 100% voting record from @civilrightsorg. I stand with the Leadership Conference on Civil and Human Rights in the fight for justice, whether it's the John Lewis Voting Rights Act or the Dream Act. It's time for the Senate to end the filibuster and pass these bills!

The bipartisan #PostalServiceReformAct will:  

📪 Save $1.5 billion over ten years  
📪 Ensure mail and packages are delivered six days a week  
📪 Improve agency accountability by tracking performance

I'm voting YES for these much-needed reforms.

Social media is damaging our children’s mental health. With teen suicide rates on the rise, these sites need to remove dangerous content, like harmful "How To" videos, that could be the difference between life and death. #SaferInternetDay https://t.co/0XBgFtAelP

A medida que el porcentaje de trabajadores en una union ha disminuido, la desigualdad ha aumentado. Las recomendaciones del grupo de trabajo de la @WhiteHouse igualará oportunidades para los trabajadores. Lucho por el #PROAct para reforzar protecciones de sindicalización. https://t.co/vlVOKGzClQ

As union membership has declined, income inequality has been on the rise. The @WhiteHouse Task Force’s recommendations will help level the playing field for workers. I’m fighting for the #PROAct in Congress to support unionization efforts and strengthen bargaining protections. https://t.co/XXsTRJtrOd

Today we honor the legacy of Shirley Chisholm, the first Black woman elected to Congress and the first African American to run for President with a major party. Her unbought and unbossed leadership paved the way for generations of Black women leaders. #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/tgXsFyLuRa

When losing a spouse, widows are faced with a major drop in Social Security benefits while seeing little change in household expenses. My #Secure2100 legislation would restore benefits for widows and widowers to prevent this devastating loss of income. https://t.co/Ee4JUQK2Ru

The Trump Administration’s #DirtyWaterRule was the biggest attack on the Clean Water Act in recent history, undermining environmental protections for the drinking sources of over 117 million Americans. Today I joined 120 @HouseDemocrats to call for this rule’s swift repeal. https://t.co/uO3oSi7GX8

Congressional staff work incredibly hard to keep Congress and our country running. If staff exercises their right to unionize, I am fully supportive. I voted last year to increase office budgets by 21%. It's time we make this law.

I wrote the nation's first #FMLA law in the CT State Senate. We've made great progress but it's past time for paid family & medical leave to be a reality for all workers. Americans must be able to take care of themselves & their families while paying their bills! #paidleaveforALL https://t.co/kFCWtqWKNq

6.6 MILLION jobs were created in @POTUS' first year in office. Our efforts to put money in people’s pockets and get Americans back to work with the #AmericanRescuePlan are working. https://t.co/4VQcs6nlzI
Today is #WorldCancerDay. With @POTUS’ Cancer Moonshot initiative, we can find new treatments and cures to end this disease as we know it. https://t.co/ym5I2nTI7j

Known as the first lady of civil rights, we honor Rosa Parks on her birthday and throughout #BlackHistoryMonth for her leadership in the Montgomery Bus Boycott and lifetime of activism that has inspired generations of Americans in the pursuit of justice. https://t.co/uoeeLp0v00

This #TransitEquityDay, we remain committed to safe and reliable public transit. Reducing our reliance on automobiles lowers emissions and makes communities more accessible for all residents. The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law is funding improvements to achieve this vision. https://t.co/CZCoiJOizQ

Happy #LunarNewYear! May the Year of the Tiger be one of joy and prosperity for all who are celebrating today.

With the new Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, we can rebuild our transportation system, refortify our levees, reconnect our communities, eliminate congestion, and transform the region. A long-envisioned hope is now becoming a reality for Greater Hartford. https://t.co/Xcz8maUCzm

.@POTUS has called #SocialSecurity a "sacred trust" between federal government and the people. It is Congress’ responsibility to honor it by protecting & improving Social Security. Let's pass Social Security 2100: A Sacred Trust Act to do that. #Secure2100

A lot has changed in our country since the first #SocialSecurity check went out 82 years ago. Let's pass Social Security 2100: A Sacred Trust Act to bring the program into this century and make the first improvements in 50 years! #Secure2100 https://t.co/ScEZOWd7WE

The COVID-19 pandemic has underscored just how important Social Security is to our country. It has NEVER missed a payment. We must pass Social Security 2100: A Sacred Trust Act to protect and improve benefits. #Secure2100

82 years ago, Ida May Fuller received the very first #SocialSecurity check. I introduced Social Security 2100: A Sacred Trust to strengthen #SocialSecurity. Together, we will ensure this program continues to serve our country for years to come! #Secure2100 https://t.co/ROkyi6X4uJ

Great news: the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, which I voted for, will provide nearly $72 million dollars right to Connecticut to improve our ports and waterways, prevent flooding, create jobs & economic opportunity, and strengthen our water infrastructure.

On #HolocaustRemembranceDay, we honor the millions of victims who suffered this unspeakable tragedy and reflect on the lessons learned.

We can no longer burden Americans with thousands of dollars in debt for seeking higher education. I joined my Democratic colleagues from the House & Senate urging the President to forgive $50,000 in student loan debt per borrower. https://t.co/nqE73HQaZe

We passed the Women’s Health Protection Act in the U.S. House so that no court and no state legislature can take away a woman’s right to make her own health care decisions anywhere in this country. The Senate cannot let the filibuster stand in the way of reproductive freedom!

Here in Connecticut, we have passed protections at the state level to ensure access to safe and legal abortion even if Roe v. Wade is overturned. I was proud to support this legislation and lead these efforts in the State Senate when I served as President pro tempore.

Today the importance of #RoeVWade is felt more than ever. As we approach the 49th anniversary of this landmark decision protecting the right to choose, the Supreme Court chose to ignore precedent and keep Texas’ near-total ban on abortion care in place. https://t.co/DWG3qwk61B

I joined my colleagues urging the Department of Health and Human Services to ensure Medicare beneficiaries have access to free, at-home COVID tests. Seniors enrolled in Medicare should be able to have the same access as those enrolled in private insurance. https://t.co/j3fbuxbhwK

#AbortionIsHealthcare! Justice Sotomayor is spot on. She wrote: "This case is a disaster for the rule of law and a grave disservice to women in Texas, who have a right to control their own bodies." The Senate must pass the Women's Health Protection Act! https://t.co/IYpwHuwomq

No one should have to choose between heating their home and putting food on the table. We doubled funding in Congress for home heating assistance through the #AmericanRescuePlan. Visit the link below to learn more about eligibility and how to apply. https://t.co/aKcJDoPVuC

The January 6th insurrection is a dark stain on our nation’s history. One year later and our democracy remains at stake. While many Republicans deny the tragedy of what happened, we must act to hold perpetrators accountable & ensure attacks on our democracy are unsuccessful.
